page.title: 09INTERVIEW - F.A. CUP REFEREE
page.content: Mr. Willis has lived here for 19 years,would not go anywhere else, and in 1984 retired from the police force. He is president of the English Football Referees Association and is one of the most respected and best known referees in the country. In 1985 he became the first referee to send off a player in the Wembly Cup Final for foul play for which he recieved much criticism. A 6'4" ex-guardsman he sets a magnificent example to aspiring referees with his strong personality and no-nonsense approach to football. He spends many hours of his spare time travelling to various parts of England lecturing to Referee Societies.He is totally dedicated to maintaining the standard of referees in this country.A very respected inhabitant of Brandon.
